business.headline: Essar Group co-founder Shashi Ruia dies at 81The Ruia family described Shashi Ruia's legacy as a guiding light for future generations, vowing to uphold the values and vision he championed throughout his life.
Sensex, Nifty extend gains but earnings concerns loom; Infosys gains 2% The S&P BSE Sensex was up 238.80 points to 80,348.65, while the NSE Nifty50 added 79.70 points to 24,301.80.

TotalEnergies pauses business with Adani Group amid bribery rowTotalEnergies has paused new financial investments in the Adani Group amid corruption allegations against Adani Green Energy executives, emphasising its zero-tolerance policy on misconduct.
Adani Green Energy shares tank 11% today. Here's why Adani Green Energy share price: Adani Green Energy shares dropped 11% after TotalEnergies made a crucial announcement during late trading hours.
Sensex, Nifty close higher amid market rally, Adani Green shares down 9% The S&P BSE Sensex added 992.84 points to end at 80,109.85, while the NSE Nfity50 gained 314.65 points to close at 24,221.90.

CNG prices hiked by Rs 2 in Mumbai, other cities; election bound-Delhi sparedPrices were hiked in Noida, Greater Noida, Ghaziabad, Gurugram and other cities but Delhi, which goes to polls in a few weeks from now, was spared.

NTPC Green Energy IPO share price: Strong debut on D-Street or muted listing? NTPC Green Energy IPO listing: Shares of NTPC Green Energy Limited are expected to make its debut on the stock exchanges on Wednesday after having been subscribed over 200%.

Adani Group shares rise for 2nd straight session: 2 reasons behind bull runAdani group stocks: Adani stocks continued their upward movement, with Adani Energy Solutions being among the top performers.
Zomato shares jump 7%, inclusion on BSE replacing JSW Steel soonZomato share price: Zomato stocks surged in early trade on Monday, mirroring the stock market rally following a major announcement.

Sensex jumps over 1,000 points in early trade, Nifty over 24,000Stock market rally: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 1192.49 points to 80,309.60, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 411.85 points to 24,319.10.

Enviro Infra Engineers IPO Day 2: Shoud you subscribe based on latest GMP?Enviro Infra Engineers IPO: Enviro Infra Engineers Limited is looking to raise Rs 650.43 crore through a book-building process and will close for bidding on November 26, 2024.

Amazon's quick commerce service code named Tez to challenge Blinkit, ZeptoThe move will mark Amazon's entry into the fast-growing quick commerce space in India, where competitors like Blinkit, Zepto, and Swiggy Instamart currently dominate.

NTPC Green Energy IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusNTPC Green Energy IPO allotment: The allotment for NTPC Green Energy IPO is expected to be finalised on Monday and investors and check their status on the online portals of BSE and Kfin Technologies Limited.

Zomato, RVNL, Zee, HDFC, HCL, Cochin Shipyard: Stocks to watch today Experts suggest the election outcome will boost investor confidence, especially in sectors like infrastructure, manufacturing, and urban development, which align with BJP's pro-business policies.

Adani firm downplays Kenya scrapping $736 million power deal: No material impactAdani Energy Solutions said there was "no material impact" on the company's operations after Kenya cancelled a $736 million transmission line project over Gautam Adani's indictment in a bribery case in the US.

BJP-led Mahayuti win Maharashtra: Will it lead to 'maha' rally on Dalal Street?The results of the Maharashtra assembly election, announced on Saturday, are expected to have a notable impact on the stock markets when trading resumes on Monday.

Elon Musk gets even richer after wealth hits all-time high post Trump winThe jump in Elon Musk's fortune came after Tesla shares rose 3.8% on Friday, reaching a 3.5-year closing high of $352.56 per share.

Jeff Bezos denies Musk's claim on Tesla stock advice: '100% not true'Elon Musk said on social media platform X that Bezos had advised people to sell their Tesla and SpaceX shares, predicting Donald Trump's electoral defeat.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: 5 killed in Pak as Imran Khan's supporters march to Islamabad, clash with policeMonday's violence marked a significant escalation in the ongoing confrontation between Imran Khan's party and the Shehbaz Sharif-led government.

Chandigarh clubs damaged in suspected crude bomb attack, window panes brokenTwo suspects on a motorcycle threw a low-intensity explosive at a club in Chandigarh, shattering its window panes. Another nearby club also sustained minor damage from the impact.

Mahayuti still mum on chief minister, Maharashtra assembly term ends todayMaharashtra Election: The Mahayuti alliance secured a landslide victory in the Maharashtra Assembly elections. However, a power tussle over the Chief Minister's post among alliance partners—BJP, Shiv Sena, and NCP—has clouded the post-poll celebrations.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi's father quashes age fraud rumours after historic IPL dealVaibhav Suryavanshi made history by becoming the youngest player in IPL ever. The 13-year-old's father Sanjiv Suryavanshi quashed all rumours surrounding his age fraud.
Are nicotine stains on your teeth irreversible?Home remedies might offer minor improvements, but they often fall short when addressing the damage caused by prolonged tobacco use.

Sambhal violence: Samajwadi MP named as key accused, FIR says he provoked mobThe Sambhal Police accused Samajwadi Party MP Zia ur Rahman Warq of inciting communal violence to disrupt a court-ordered survey at the Shahi Jama Masjid for political gains.

Coach Gautam Gambhir to return from Australia for family emergencyIndia head coach Gautam Gambhir is returning from Australia due to a family emergency. Gambhir is however expected to be back before the second Test match in Adelaide.

Kash Patel top choice to be Trump's FBI or Justice Department pick: ReportThe interest in Patel, following the selection of John Ratcliffe as CIA director and Tulsi Gabbard as director of national intelligence, reflects the US President-elect's urge to appoint allies to key law enforcement and intelligence roles.

Trump vows big tariffs on China, Mexico, Canada over immigration, drug smugglingDonald Trump said he would impose a 25% tariff on Canada and Mexico until they clamp down on drugs and migrants crossing the border. He also outlined an "an additional 10% tariff, above any additional tariffs" on China.

How Delhi's picnic-time November turned into its dystopian dreadDelhi AQI: November was that month when Delhiites used to go picnicking and bask in the sun. Skies used to be clear blue before the annual shroud of smog started enveloping Delhi and snatched the best month from Delhi and its residents. Now, people step out into the toxic air only when needed.

Clash at Udaipur palace over feud between Mewar family head and cousin, 3 injuredUdaipur Clashes: The situation outside Udaipur City Palace remained tense with a heavy deployment of police after BJP MLA Vishvaraj Singh and his supporters were denied entry, hours after he was anointed the titular head of the erstwhile royal family of Mewar.

Israelis skipping army duty as fatigue of never-ending war deepensThe Israel-Hamas war has been ongoing for more than a year, and a Lebanon chapter has been added. Now, many Israeli reservists, people who enlisted in the war and had thought it would end soon, are now seeing combat fatigue. Many Israelis have started skipping military duty.

Sarfaraz Khan goes unsold, brother Musheer gets PunjabKings contractIPL mega auction: Musheer Khan will play in the Indian Premier League for the first time. The 19-year-old secured a Rs 30 lakh contract from Punjab Kings. His brother Sarfaraz did not find takers in the initial rounds.

Sunil Gavaskar in awe of Jasprit Bumrah's captaincy, decodes Virat Kohli changeSpeaking to India Today, legendary Sunil Gavaskar praised Jasprit Bumrah's captaincy in the Perth Test. education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
